metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3144 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The fix_hostname function in cURL and libcurl 7.37.0 through 7.41.0 doesnot properly calculate an index, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (out-of-bounds read or write and crash) or possibly haveother unspecified impact via a zero-length host name, as demonstrated by"http://:80" and ":80."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.3
libcurl3 - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.3
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.3
libcurl3-nss - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.35.0-1ubuntu2.3').
